Package model.interfaces

Interface DicePair

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<DicePair>
    public interface DicePair
extends java.lang.Comparable<DicePair>
     Assignment interface for Further Programming representing a pair of Dice in the game
 
 IMPORTANT: To facilitate testing, your implementation of this class should be model.DicePairImpl
 i.e. a class named DicePairImpl residing in the model package
 The implementing class should be immutable since this interface specifies no setter methods
 The implementing class should provide a no argument constructor which creates the two dice 
 with randomly generated values using the specified constructor of DieImpl i.e.
    public DieImpl(int value, int numFaces) throws IllegalArgumentException
    Author:
    Caspar Ryan

      • getDie1

      • getDie2

        Die getDie2()
        Returns:
        the second Die of this pair

      • getTotal

        int getTotal()
        Returns:
        the total value of the two dice (i.e. the sum of the values of die1 and die2)

      • equals

        boolean equals​(DicePair dicePair)
        Parameters:
        dicePair - - another DicePair to compare with
        Returns:
        true if both Dice are equal according to Die.equals(Die) NOTE: order is enforced 3,6 is != 6,3

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a human readable String that lists the values of this DicePair
         instance (see OutputTrace.pdf) 
 
 This method should use Die.toString() where appropriate as part of the formatted output
         
 e.g. "Dice 1: Five,  Dice 2: One .. Total: 6"
